Notifications.DependencyDescription: O Atual versão {name} não suporta todas as Funções do Mainsail. Atualize {name} para {neededVersion}.

KlipperWarnings.DeprecatedOption: A Opção '{option}' na sessão '{section}' foi descontinuada e será removida em uma futura versão.
KlipperWarnings.DeprecatedValue: Valor '{value}' na opção '{option}' na sessão '{section}' foi descontinuada e será removido em uma atualização futura.

MoonrakerWarnings.MoonrakerFailedComponentDescription: Um erro foi detectado enquanto estava tentando carregar o componente do moonraker '{component}'. Por favor, cheque Os Arquivos de Log e tente resolver o problema.
MoonrakerWarnings.UnparsedConfigOption: Opção de configuração não-analisada. Opção: '{option}' com o valor '{value}' detectada na seção [{section}]. Esta pode ser uma opção que não está mais disponível ou pode ser o resultado de um módulo que falhou ao tentar carregar. No futuro, isso resultará em um erro!
MoonrakerWarnings.UnparsedConfigSection: Seção de configuração não-analisada detectada: [{section}]. Isso pode ser o resultado de um componente que falhou ao tentar carregar. No futuro, isso resultará em um erro!

NumberInput.GreaterOrEqualError: Deve ser MAIOR ou IGUAL a {min}!
NumberInput.NoEmptyAllowedError: O Campo não pode estar Vazio.

ThrottledStates.DescriptionCurrentlyThrottled: Os núcleos de rPi ARM estão atualmente desacelerados.
ThrottledStates.DescriptionFrequencyCapped: A frequência máxima do rPi ARM está atualmente limitada a 1,2 GHz.
ThrottledStates.DescriptionPreviouslyFrequencyCapped: A frequência máxima do rPi ARM foi limitada a 1,2 GHz desde a última inicialização, no mínimo uma única vez.
ThrottledStates.DescriptionPreviouslyTemperatureLimited: A temperatura rPi uC (3A+/3B+) ficou pelo menos uma vez acima do limite (60ºC) desde a última vez que foi ligado.
ThrottledStates.DescriptionPreviouslyThrottled: Os núcleos rPI ARM foram reduzidos pelo menos uma vez desde a última inicialização.
ThrottledStates.DescriptionPreviouslyUnderVolted: A tensão de alimentação do rPI caiu abaixo de 4,65 V em algum momento desde a última inicialização.
ThrottledStates.DescriptionTemperatureLimitActive: A temperatura rPi uC (3A+/3B+) está atualmente acima do limite (60ºC).
ThrottledStates.DescriptionUnderVoltageDetected: Tensão de alimentação do rPI atualmente abaixo de 4,65V.

ControlTab.EnableXYHoming: Enable combined X & Y axes homing
ControlTab.EstimatedExtrusionInfoDescription: Show / Hide info for estimated extrusions based on extrusion amount and feedrate
ControlTab.MaximumValuesVisibility: Maximum of {maximum} values is recommended for best visibility
ControlTab.MoveDistancesXYInMm: Move distance increments X & Y axes (in mm)
ControlTab.MoveDistancesZInMm: Move distance increments Z axis (in mm)
ControlTab.ValueGreaterThan: Value has to be greater than {value}

EditorTab.ConfirmUnsavedChanges: Prompt to save or discard unsaved changes
EditorTab.ConfirmUnsavedChangesDescription: If enabled, the editor requires a confirmation to either save or discard the changes made. If disabled, changes are silently discarded.
EditorTab.KlipperRestartMethodDescription: Select which restart method will be used on 'Save & Restart' when editing Klipper config files.
EditorTab.MoonrakerRestartInstanceDescription: Select which Moonraker service will restart on 'Save & Restart' when editing Moonraker config files.
EditorTab.UseEscToCloseDescription: Allows the ESC key to close the editor

GeneralTab.BackupDialog: Please select all the sections you want to create a backup:
GeneralTab.CalcEstimateTimeDescription: If multiple are selected, an average will be calculated
GeneralTab.CalcEtaTimeDescription: If multiple are selected, an average will be calculated
GeneralTab.CalcPrintProgressDescription: Method for calculating the print progress.
GeneralTab.FactoryDialog: Please select all the sections you want to reset:
GeneralTab.RestoreDialog: Please select all the sections you want to restore:

MacrosTab.ChangeMacroColor: Change the color of the button.
MacrosTab.Name: Name

PresetsTab.Name: Name
PresetsTab.PresetInfo: Please set at least a target temperature or a custom G-Code.

RemotePrintersTab.UseConfigJson: InstanceDB = JSON detected. Please use the config.json to modify the printers list.

TimelapseTab.AutorenderDescription: If enabled, the timelapse video will automatically render at the end of the print
TimelapseTab.CameraDescription: Select which camera should be used
TimelapseTab.ConstantRateFactorDescription: This configure quality vs file size of the rendered video. The range of the CRF scale is 0–51, where 0 is lossless, 23 is the default and 51 is worst quality possible. A lower value generally leads to higher quality and a subjectively sane range is 17–28. Consider 17 or 18 to be visually lossless.
TimelapseTab.duplicatelastframeDescription: Duplicates the last frame on the end of the video
TimelapseTab.EnabledDescription: If disabled, G-Code macros are ignored and auto-render is skipped.
TimelapseTab.ExtraoutputparamsDescription: Defines extra output parameters to FFMPEG. Note: Specifying anything here will disable the rotation setting
TimelapseTab.FwRetractDescription: Use firmware retraction in the timelapse macro
TimelapseTab.GcodeVerboseDescription: If enabled, G-Code macros will write information to the console
TimelapseTab.HyperlapseCycleDescription: A snapshot will be taken any X seconds
TimelapseTab.ModeDescription: Select between Layer macro and Hyperlapse (time-based) mode
TimelapseTab.OutputFramerateDescription: Defines the framerate of the video. Note: this will be ignored if variable_fps is enabled
TimelapseTab.ParkheadDescription: If enabled, the toolhead will be parked before taking a frame.
TimelapseTab.ParkTimeDescription: Add additional idle time when parking.
TimelapseTab.PixelformatDescription: Defines the pixel format of the output video
TimelapseTab.PreviewImageDescription: Save a preview image with the same name as the video
TimelapseTab.RetractDistanceDescription: The length of filament that the extruder retracts.
TimelapseTab.RetractSpeedDescription: Speed at which the extruder retracts the filament.
TimelapseTab.SaveFramesDescription: Save the frames to a zip-file for external rendering
TimelapseTab.TargetlengthDescription: The target length when Variable FPS is enabled
TimelapseTab.TimeFormatCodeDescription: This defines how the timestamp in the output file should be encoded
TimelapseTab.TravelSpeedDescription: Travel speed while moving to the parking position and resuming
TimelapseTab.UnretractDistanceDescription: The length of filament that the extruder unretracts after a retraction.
TimelapseTab.UnretractSpeedDescription: Speed at which the extruder unretracts the filament after a retraction.
TimelapseTab.VariableFpsDescription: If enabled, the framerate of the output video will be calculated based on target length

UiSettingsTab.BoolBigThumbnailDescription: Display a large thumbnail in the status panel during a print.
UiSettingsTab.BoolHideUploadAndPrintButtonDescription: Show or hide the "Upload and Print" button in the top bar.
UiSettingsTab.ConfirmOnEmergencyStopDescription: Show a confirmation dialog on Emergency Stop
UiSettingsTab.ConfirmOnPowerDeviceChange: Require confirm on Device Power changes
UiSettingsTab.ConfirmOnPowerDeviceChangeDescription: Show a confirmation dialog on Device Power changes
UiSettingsTab.DisableFanAnimationDescription: This can reduce some load in your Browser.
UiSettingsTab.DisplayCANCEL_PRINTDescription: Shows the CANCEL_PRINT button permanently - no second layer confirmation needed.
UiSettingsTab.GcodeThumbnailsDescription: Click on the button to get to the instructions.
UiSettingsTab.HideSaveConfigButtonForBedMesh: Hide SAVE_CONFIG button for bed_mesh changes
UiSettingsTab.HideSaveConfigButtonForBedMeshDescriptio: Hide SAVE_CONFIG, if only bed_mesh changes are pending to be saved in Klipper.
UiSettingsTab.LockSlidersDelayDescription: Sliders will lock after a given delay. If set to 0 or left blank, sliders will only lock on page change/reload.
UiSettingsTab.LockSlidersDescription: Sliders on touchscreens need to be unlocked before changes are allowed.
UiSettingsTab.PowerDeviceNameDescription: Select which Moonraker power device should be used to power on the printer.
